subject: Personal Finance
title: Why Falling Prices Are Dangerous
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Falling Prices Are Dangerous.

hook.text: Falling prices sound great until you realize nobody buys anything because it'll be cheaper tomorrow.

buildup.text: Deflation means the general price level is declining. Money becomes more valuable over time.

discovery.text: When people delay purchases, businesses earn less, fire workers, who then spend even less.

twist.text: Debts become crushing. You borrowed $100,000 but now it buys more â€” and you still owe every dollar.

climax.text: The Great Depression featured severe deflation. Prices fell 25% in four years.

punchline.text: Falling prices can freeze an economy.

quiz.question: Why is deflation dangerous?
options: People delay spending, creating a downward spiral
Prices become too low for stores
